title: "I only have Yasuo"
body: Got that in a Dynamic Q game. Which you must have at least 16 champions in order to play. When I pointed this out, I got told "STFU Noob". Another guy was like "REKT". Why do people even say stupid things like that, are they that hard for specific champions?

replies.body: Its called one trick pony
That's no excuse.

What does it matter if the guy wants to pay Yasuo only. Is there a set rule that enforces champ pick diversity? Rito is already enforcing so much shit into the meta and the way we play this game, could we not?
He flat out lied is the point here. It's like saying "I only own 1 rune page" when the game gives you 2 at the start.
He might only have one with runes on it
But he OWNS 2

Lets put it this way. You have 2 cars. One of them is fine and normal. The other one has everything in the interior removed, has no engine, and has no way whatsoever of working. But it looks normal.

Now, if someone asks to use your cars. Are you going to tell them sure,and let them use the useless car along with the functioning one, or are you going to say you only have 1 car
I own 2 cars but 1 isn't working, I still own 2 cars.
*I own one car and one car frame.
By "interior removed" is he referring to the inside being hallow or no radio, no seat covers, no seat belts?

> [{quoted}](name=SanicTheMemehog,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=0002000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-18T05:19:51.174+0000)
>
> The other one has everything in the interior removed, has no engine, and has no way whatsoever of working.

If you have 2 rune pages, and 1 is full, clearly you can afford the runes to put SOMETHING into the second. It's like having the engine next to the car. Plus OP's main point was 16 champs being required for ranked queues. How can someone only own Yasuo?

what happened to cart before the horse
now its all this automobile nonsense

One-Trick Ponies can be potent weapons if not banned. If you've met a Mastery 7 main, you know they are probably your best option for victory.

Besides, just owning a champion does not imply experience. I own Evelynn but last I played her was URF of '15. I have no idea what'd come after Runic > Rylai.

I mean, I own {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:236}} and I know their basic mechanics but the only ADC I **WANT** to play is {{champion:202}}. Same thing for most One-Tricks.
But you still have the champs, if you say "I only play" then you're not a liar, just an idiot for not learning more than one champ.
I don't think a car without an engine or any interior gadgets can really be consider just "isn't working."
Never said it was working, but it's still a car. If you have a house and there' no bathroom, is it not a house?

Yeah, it'd be an awfully shitty one, though. In several senses of the word.

That's not the equivalent metaphor, though. It'd be like saying you had the _facades_ of a house, but it wasn't actually much more than walls and it didn't even have a roof, it just looked like it had one from the outside due to really good perspective tricks.
An empty house with furniture outside. But you still have a house. That's a rune page with no runes. You own it, but it's not useful.
A rune page with no runes does literally nothing. An empty house - as opposed to the facades of the house - still protects you from the elements.
Perhaps people are taking what he said far too literally.

> [{quoted}](name=Galacticamaru,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-06-17T23:32:25.685+0000)
>
> What does it matter if the guy wants to pay Yasuo only. Is there a set rule that enforces champ pick diversity? Rito is already enforcing so much shit into the meta and the way we play this game, could we not?

Depends on the role more or less, Yas does amazing top and mid, so he can go nuts all he wants if those are his two roles. Yes it sucks if top is last pick and he picks Yasuo when a team needs a tank, but meh, as long as he does well then why does it matter.

I will say though if someone picks Yas as jng, adc, or sup. I would probably mute them instantly and report them at the end of the game for being a troll.
Hey, I've won a game as ADC leblanc once. haha
League has only one pony. {{champion:120}}

> [{quoted}](name=BloodyTompon,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-06-18T08:34:03.496+0000)
>
> League has only one pwny. {{champion:120}}
Ftfy
They prob are only comfortable with that champ
Still, thats rather sad and pathetic. The game requires you to have a champion pool, rather then putting all your eggs into one basket and it was the way he said it. It was so funny.

I main riven and took her to diamond 6 times this season. To expand my champ pool I created another acc and only played yasuo top to diamond. The game doesn't require a giant champ pool. With the new champ select u are guaranteed to get ur role or something close to it. Riven jungle riven top. I can always play riven
Unless I ban her because she overpowered and toxic and people who main her are generally toxic as well. Stats have shown this.

> [{quoted}](name=Frostmane,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-17T18:02:01.285+0000)
>
> Unless I ban her because she overpowered and toxic and people who main her are generally toxic as well. Stats have shown this.

Riven, season 6, overpowered..

I think you may be living in the past.

Much as I hated to get off the Riven hate train, she hasn't been OP for a while.

Besides, why stay there when the Zed hate train is still running strong?
Well, her players are still the most toxic of the game, even if Riven isnt her bruiser assassin cancerqueen self in this season (God Bless).
Based on some stereotype coming Fromm the forums? Surprise surprise guess what other shit came from it? The supports and junglers can do no wrong one.

Lol there is no ''crazy stereotype coming from the forums''.

There was a legit study done by a guy, and posted in Reddit with graph and everything, that showed a correlation between toxic behavior and champions played. The most toxic ones are Riven, Vayne and Ezreal. 

And, surprise surprise, supports and junglers are actually much less toxic, barring some exceptions, because they are much more dependant of their team that mid/top/adc.

> [{quoted}](name=Frostmane,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-06-17T17:58:59.554+0000)
>
> Still, thats rather sad and pathetic. The game requires you to have a champion pool, rather then putting all your eggs into one basket and it was the way he said it. It was so funny.

There are several challenger players that only play 1 champion. Annie Bot for example.
Annie bot does not dodge, rage, cry, or become aggressive when his champ is banned. He play another champ.... Which is the OPs point.

Don't expect someone to have a huge champ pool. It is not SAD and PATHETIC for someone to be a one trick pony. It just means that they practice with that one champ a lot and enjoy playing that one champ. If Yasuo is not banned, there is absolutely no need for you to point that out. You are basically asking for an argument.

> [{quoted}](name=Jin Air Flow,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ixnl6mlV,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2016-06-17T18:09:28.856+0000)
>
> Don't expect someone to have a huge champ pool. It is not SAD and PATHETIC for someone to be a one trick pony. It just means that they practice with that one champ a lot and enjoy playing that one champ. If Yasuo is not banned, there is absolutely no need for you to point that out. You are basically asking for an argument.

I think the thing people hate one trick ponies is because they focus so much on one champ, if they lose that champ, they are worthless.

Using AzureRaven as an example, I believe they can get to Diamond on Riven, one tricks can easily rank up to such, there is no dispute there. But if Riven is banned, it is probably safe to say that on other champs they are nowhere close to Diamond skill level. It isn't 100% but its pretty safe to say if a 1 trick doesn't get their champ, they are generally total crap on any other champ. I wouldn't be surprised if even a Diamond or even higher 1 tricks would be no different than a Bronze-Gold if their champ was banned. That is a fairly huge gap, to drop from Diamond skill level to about Silver all from 1 champ.

That is the reason why being diverse is generally better. Being Diamond level on a single champ isn't something to be proud of really, being Diamond level on just about every role on the other hand is something to be proud of. When you watch on Twitch and you see those people have a champ pool of about 10-20 champs they play all at Diamond+ level, that is something to be proud of.
In my sister's ever true words "people are dumb"
Your sister is going places. Not public relations, but places.
*_Commits to memory to shamelessly steal in the future_

At which point I would just dodge, walk to fridge, get refreshment of choice, do a quick online check for something funny, and then start another game.

It's fine if someone really wants to play a champ, but being a jerk about it is a good way for you to have yo wait another 5+ minutes in que trying to get it.
Idk my favorite midlaners often get banned out {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}}
Idk man, yas isn't the biggest problem right now. Malzahar, swain, etc. hate malzahar right now.
In my elo they ban Yas though, they think he's OP
I ban yas because I hate playing around windwall ;[

Even for people that don't hate it, windwall is a hard counter to a lot of champions, including damned near 100% of the casters.  If you want to play (insert literally any ranged caster here) then Yas is a WAY higher-priority ban than Malzahar or Zed.  Malz/Zed are annoying and powerful, but they can't just arbitrarily declare that your entire kit no longer works for most of a teamfight.

It's sort of like how a lot of people that play CC-heavy champs will ban Morgana even though she's not strictly speaking all that powerful overall.  A mechanic that hard-counters your preferred champ's vital mechanics is a bigger deal than just having numbers that are a bit imbalanced.
Yas is a problem. He's melee and literally has zero counters to him. He can harass and screw up your CS with wall.
Fizz, Irelia, Malzahar, Swain, Vladimir, Viktor(,Riven) are all fine into him(off the top of my head, probably more)
